title: The Parking Spot Swap
setting: Hartwell & Associates Law Firm, parking garage, Thursday 7:30 AM
premise: Someone swapped the reserved parking signs overnight, putting the intern's name on the managing partner's premium spot. The signs were last seen correct at 7 PM Wednesday.

suspects.name: Brenda Liu
suspects.motive: Bitter about losing her parking spot to the new partner last month
suspects.alibi: I left at 6:30 PM and went to my evening yoga class at Harmony Studio from 7 to 8:30. Then I picked up groceries and was home by 9:15.

suspects.name: Owen Marsh
suspects.motive: Best friends with the intern and thinks reserved spots are unfair
suspects.alibi: I stayed late finishing a brief at my desk until around 8 PM. Then I packed up and drove straight home. I was in bed by 9:30.

suspects.name: Cathy Dunn
suspects.motive: Running a prank war with the managing partner all month
suspects.alibi: I left at 5 PM for a dentist appointment at 5:30. After that I went straight home and didn't leave again. I live thirty minutes from the office.

suspects.name: Elliot Vance
suspects.motive: Annoyed that the partner blocked his request for better server room parking access
suspects.alibi: I stayed late doing server maintenance until about 9 PM. Then I drove home from the parking garage. I was the last one to leave the building.

clues.title: Black Ink Smudges
clues.content: Fresh black ink smudges were found on both parking signs. The firm's supply closet is missing one black permanent marker. Only a marker from that brand leaves this distinctive residue.

clues.title: Night Guard's Report
clues.content: The night security guard started his shift at 9 PM and says no one entered the building after that. The garage is only accessible through the building lobby after hours.

clues.title: Security Camera Footage
clues.content: The lobby camera shows Owen leaving the building at 7:55 PM with a bag. But the garage camera shows him walking back into the parking garage from the stairwell at 8:25 PM, not leaving in his car as he claimed.
